column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=4 .
#Text=Discussion
#Text=The MDS-CVI is primarily a data-collection tool .

#Text=However , when completing the registry , healthcare professionals are reminded of important actions that can be carried out in people with risk factors such as older age , female sex , and obesity , which increase their likelihood of having CVD .
#Text=Activities to promote health , prevent CVD , and diagnose it at earlier stages will help halt or delay disease progress .
#Text=Healthcare professionals , and those working in primary health in particular , should aim to educate at-risk patients to lead a healthy lifestyle and use compression stockings .
#Text=Due to increased awareness of CVD , the tendency is generally for earlier diagnosis and treatment .
#Text=However , in some countries , the disease is not detected until more advanced stages .
#Text=There are gaps in healthcare professionals ’ knowledge of venous leg ulcer physiology and its healing process , partly due to a lack of training at a degree level .
#Text=By applying and incorporating this MDS-CVI in patients ’ health records , healthcare professionals will find it easier to monitor the disease course at every stage .
#Text=Above all , they should follow the recommendations to ensure correct diagnosis and treatment .
#Text=The CEAP classification system is a very easy method to classify venous disease and reach a reliable diagnosis of CVD/CVI in the population .
#Text=The clinical part of the system can be obtained simply by observing a patient ’s legs in the primary care setting .
#Text=It is estimated that 80 % of the population have the mildest level of symptoms ( C1 – C2 , spider and varicose veins ) , while 5 % have the most advanced stages ( C3 – C6 ) .

#Text=Implementation of this evidence-based MDS-CVI would result in more reliable data collection and facilitate monitoring of a specific population to observe disease progression , the treatments used , and their effectiveness .

#Text=With the existing level of evidence of the importance of therapeutic compression of the lower limbs , it is unacceptable that 90 % of patients with CVI in Turkey and 54 % of patients with venous ulcers in Spain are not given compression stockings .
#Text=The MDS-CVI will also permit health managers to plan interventions according to the venous state of the population and identify which quality indicators should be applied .
#Text=People with CVI have a poor quality of life .
#Text=It is therefore important to determine how the venous disease affects each individual .

#Text=Specific instruments are available to measure quality of life in these patients , such as the Aberdeen Varicose Vein Questionnaire ( AVVQ ) or the Chronic Venous Insufficiency Quality of Life Questionnaire ( CIVIC ) for patients with CVI , and the Charing Cross Venous Ulcer Questionnaire for patients with venous ulcers .
#Text=The instruments are valid for only certain languages and cultures and they therefore need to be adapted to be effective .

#Text=Non-pharmacological measures are essential in the prevention and adjuvant therapy of CVD and healthcare professionals should therefore be aware of their existence and use them in their clinical practice .
#Text=Recommendations such as weight loss or taking regular exercise will help venous return and delay symptom progression .
#Text=The MDS for CVI establishes minimum quality care criteria and can help to guide in the purchase of necessary services .
